channel.title: Cluster Tags on
channel.description: Recent content in Cluster Tags on

item.title: Create Cluster Tags
item.description:
This section explains how to create cluster tags.

Prerequisites

You should have the Cluster Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Cluster Management permission.

  2. Click Cluster Management.

  3. On the Cluster Management page, click the Cluster Tags tab to open the list of cluster tags.

  4. Click Create on the page.

  5. In the Create Tags dialog, set the key and value for the tag, then click Create.

    • Click Add to create multiple tags at once.

    • Click next to a tag to delete it.

item.title: Edit Cluster Tags
item.description:
This section explains how to edit cluster tags.

Prerequisites

You should have the Cluster Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Cluster Management permission.

  2. Click Cluster Management.

  3. On the Cluster Management page, click the Cluster Tags tab to open the list of cluster tags.

  4. Click next to the tag you want to edit, then select Edit from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Edit Tag dialog, set the key and value for the tag, then click OK.

item.title: Add Tags to Clusters
item.description:
This section explains how to add tags to a cluster.

Prerequisites

You should have the Cluster Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Cluster Management permission.

  2. Click Cluster Management.

  3. On the Cluster Management page, click the Cluster Tags tab to open the list of cluster tags.

  4. Click next to the tag you want to add, then select Add to Clusters from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Add Tag to Clusters dialog, select the cluster where you want to add the tag, then click OK.

item.title: Remove Tags from Clusters
item.description:
This section explains how to remove tags from a cluster.

Prerequisites

You should have the Cluster Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Cluster Management permission.

  2. Click Cluster Management.

  3. On the Cluster Management page, click the Cluster Tags tab to open the list of cluster tags.

  4. Click next to the tag you want to remove, then select Remove from Clusters from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Remove Tag from Clusters dialog, click next to the cluster from which you want to remove the tag, then click OK.

item.title: Delete Cluster Tags
item.description:
This section explains how to delete cluster tags.

Note

If a tag has been added to a cluster, deleting the tag will also remove it from the cluster.

Prerequisites

You should have the Cluster Management permission on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, refer to "Platform Roles".

Delete a Single Tag

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Cluster Management permission.

  2. Click Cluster Management.

  3. On the Cluster Management page, click the Cluster Tags tab to open the list of cluster tags.

  4. Click next to the tag you want to delete, then select Delete from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Delete Tag dialog, enter the key and value of the tag, then click OK.
